definition: to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield

sentences.english: The temple stands, however, and the words are here.
sentences.chinese: 而神廟還在，這些祭文也在這裏。

sentences.english: You will reverse the summons, returning me to the fire dreams.
sentences.chinese: 你再用祭文把我送回到火之夢中。

sentences.english: Lincoln's inaugural address, brave and elegiac as it was, was speaking into a hurricane.
sentences.chinese: 林肯的就職演說，勇敢，祭文，因爲它被說成颶風。

sentences.english: The tutor copied one from the book and gave it to the rich man.
sentences.chinese: 這個塾師從書本上抄了一篇，就把祭文給了富人。

sentences.english: He read a beautiful address to the soul of his dead friend.
sentences.chinese: 他在亡友靈前宣讀了一篇感人的祭文。

sentences.english: Already no time to see, the pomegranate on the balcony, speaks obituaries.
sentences.chinese: 已經等不及看，陽臺上的石榴，說出的祭文。

sentences.english: President Obama will be delivered the funeral oration.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬總統將在喪禮上發表祭文。

definition: variant of 頌詞|颂词[song4 ci2]
preface/foreword/preamble/recital (law)/also written 敘文|叙文[xu4 wen2]
